repnme.cdata!: Brazil - Rio Reconstruction and Prevention Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project was designed as an emergency
            response to damage from severe floods in the Metropolitan
            Region of Rio de Janeiro at the end of February 1988. It had
            three major objectives: (a) to assist state and municipal
            authorities in the Metropolitan Region of Rio de Janeiro in
            urgent reconstruction and rehabilitation made necessary by
            the floods and landslides;( b) to implement essential
            physical works designed to minimize and prevent future flood
            damage; and (c) to assist state and municipal authorities in
            developing a program and the institutional capacity to cope
            better with future emergencies. The project included
            reconstruction components such as repair of roads and
            bridges, repair and rehabilitation of public buildings
            damaged, and the provision of minimally serviced sites for
            families whose homes were destroyed during the floods and
            landslides. Except for repair of buildings (which had
            already been reconstructed by the time funds became
            available), implementation of the above components was
            substantially in accordance with the original objectives.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio Flood Reconstruction and
            Prevention Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rio Flood Reconstruction and
            Prevention Project, to be implemented over a two-year
            period, consists of both reconstruction and preventative
            activities.  The reconstruction activities consist of
            rehabilitation and repair of infrastructure damaged by the
            floods and accompanying landslides, while the preventative
            activities are designed to minimize damage otherwise likely
            to occur during any future major rains.  The project
            consists of the following components:  (a) repair of roads
            and bridges; (b) repairs and dredging of drainage systems;
            and (c) terracing, buttressing, retaining walls, and other
            structural stabilization of steep hillsides.  It also
            includes (d) repairs of sewerage systems, and essential
            extension of sewerage networks; (e) improved collection and
            disposal of solid wastes; (f) reforestation of steep
            hillsides most likely to slide; and (g) provision of
            minimally serviced sites for families whose homes were
            destroyed during the floods or landslides and for families
            needing to be resettled. Finally, the project involves (h)
            repairs and rehabilitation of public buildings; (i) purchase
            of imported rescue and salvage equipment; (j)
            consultants' services and technical assistance; and
            project administration.
